snippet: Experts said they expected no drastic changes in government policies toward Muslims, but they held out hope that things at least would not become worse.
abstract: Officials from National League for Democracy, leaders of Myanmar's new government, give no indications they plan on easing government discriminatory policies toward Muslims or Rohingya, predominantly Muslim group even denied citizenship rights; silence from new government is dashing optimism of human rights organizations hoping conditions would change for two beleaguered groups.

byline.contributor: Eaint Thiri Thu and Saw Nang contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Experts said they expected no drastic changes in government policies toward Muslims, but they held out hope that things at least would not become worse.

headline.main: After Myanmar Election, Few Signs of a Better Life for Muslims
headline.print_headline: New Leaders in Myanmar Unlikely to Improve the Lives of Muslims

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
